definition: to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: Currency movements switch demand between countries; they do not create it.
sentences.chinese: 货币流动需要在国家之间进行切换，而不能凭空捏造。

sentences.english: Her impression with regard to Isabel's writing was quite illusory.
sentences.chinese: 关于伊莎贝尔的写作，她完全是凭空捏造的。

sentences.english: There is nothing in it; the whole story is an absolute invention.
sentences.chinese: 全是假话，整个故事是凭空捏造出来的。

definition: to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
